text: 15.31 Part 4 supports the development of employment uses outside of designated employment locations, provided they meet certain criteria. Part 4(a) supports employment uses where they serve a place-making function within a development, for example by activating inactive spaces or providing a focal point. Part 4(b) recognises that there are areas of the borough outside of designated employment locations that contain clusters of employment uses, and that these areas are likely to be suitable for new employment uses. Part 4(c) recognises the positive role that temporary uses can play in activating and making efficient use of spaces while they await development.
